paragraphs: I design and build backend systems, infrastructure, and security-focused services with an emphasis on correctness, reliability, scalability, and long-term maintainability.

Based in Peru, I work primarily in Unix-like environments (Arch Linux daily, Debian/Ubuntu for servers) and focus on backend engineering, identity and access management, API gateways, and event-driven architectures.
I'm especially interested in backend platform engineering and security-critical systems, where clean architecture and low attack surface truly matter.

highlights: Development and implementation of websites and landing pages for SMEs and local businesses.
Application of responsive design, service-oriented structure and good usability practices.

Secure deployment of applications using Cloudflare Tunnel, avoiding direct exposure of public IPs and ports.
Internal communication between services through private VPN with Tailscale, reducing attack surface and improving isolation.
Implementation and consumption of Azure Event Hub for asynchronous communication between services.
Deployment and basic administration of virtual machines in Azure with Debian and Ubuntu.
Post-delivery maintenance and technical support, with focus on stability and availability.
